name: Cisco Tetration Analytics
description: This app supports variety of investigative actions on Cisco Tetration Analytics

actions.verbose:
If the filter is empty (i.e. {}), then the query matches all flows. If parameter dimensions is not specified, flowsearch returns all the available dimensions. This option is useful to specify a subset of the available dimensions when the caller does not care about the rest of the dimensions. If parameter metrics is not specified, flowsearch results returns all the available metrics. This option is useful to specify a subset of the available metrics when the caller does not care about the rest of the metrics.
The app supports multiple methods for specifying filter dictionary. Please refer to the OpenAPI documentation for more information. Below is an example for a filter dictionary:
{"type": "and", "filters": [{"type": "contains", "field": "src_hostname", "value": "prod"}, {"type": "in", "field": "dst_port", "values": ["80", "443"]}]}

start_time.description: Flow search start time (epoch or ISO 8601)

end_time.description: Flow search end time (epoch or ISO 8601)

scope_name.description: Full name of the scope to which query is restricted to

actions.description: Get endpoint details and flows of a specific IP
List all uploaded annotations of specific scope

actions.verbose:
Upload a CSV file in vault to add or delete user annotations. Vault ID or file name of uploaded CSV will be used to upload annotations. The uploaded CSV must contains IP as a column header.
Sample CSV is shown below
IP,VRF,Department,Datacenter,...,Column HeaderK
7.7.7.7,Disco,HR,SJC,...,columnK_Value
...

actions.description: Clear all annotations of specific scope
actions.verbose: Please ensure these annotations are not used by any filters or scopes as they will no longer work as expected.
